title: Sound Simulation Practice for Improving Cardiac Auscultation Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Utilizing smartphone-based sound simulation equipment for small-group practical sessions

learning_goals: Learners can identify seven abnormal heart sounds (S3, double gallop, aortic stenosis/regurgitation, mitral stenosis/regurgitation, pericardial friction rub) with 80% accuracy.
Learners can systematically perform auscultation procedures by applying optimal listening points when using a stethoscope
Learners can integratively apply heart sound analysis skills to real clinical cases through team-based diagnostic projects

resources: Auscultation Audio Database for Heart Sounds
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
